sentences.english: Then disengage from the Gregorian mind trap and re-connect with the synchronic order.
sentences.chinese: 然後脫離陽曆銘記陷阱和重新連接同步秩序。

sentences.english: The date usually falls in mid-January.
sentences.chinese: 這個節日通常在陽曆一月中旬來臨。

sentences.english: Chinese calendar is a combination of solar and lunar calendar.
sentences.chinese: 中國曆是陽曆和陰曆的結合。

sentences.english: Fenyang has a long history and deep culture.
sentences.chinese: 汾陽曆史悠久，文化底蘊深厚。

sentences.english: The date of the Laba Festival usually falls in mid-January.
sentences.chinese: 臘八節的陽曆日期通常在1月中旬。

sentences.english: Today is her birthday according to the solar calendar.
sentences.chinese: 按照陽曆，今天是她的生日。

sentences.english: It is built according to the solar calendar.
Fuyang, history and culture unique ecological tourism.
sentences.chinese: 阜陽曆史文化悠久，生態旅遊環境獨特。

sentences.english: It falls around April 5 of the Gregorian calendar.
sentences.chinese: 它是在陽曆四月五號前後。

sentences.english: When did you change the date of Yuandan to the solar calendar?
sentences.chinese: 你們什麼時候把元旦日期變成陽曆的。

sentences.english: That was on June the 4 th , two days after the Dragonboat Festival.
sentences.chinese: 那正是舊曆端陽節後二天，陽曆六月四日。

sentences.english: Today, these local history books have become treasurable literatures for people to study the history of Anyang.
sentences.chinese: 現在這些志書已成爲人們研究安陽曆史的珍貴文獻。

definition: the traditional Chinese calendar/the lunar calendar
old calendar/the Chinese lunar calendar/same as 農曆|农历[nong2 li4]
colloquial term for 生肖[sheng1 xiao4] the animals associated with the years of a 12-year cycle
Dragon Boat Festival (5th day of the 5th lunar month)
9-11 pm (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
Lantern Festival, the final event of the Spring Festival 春節|春节, on 15th of first month of the lunar calendar
11 pm-1 am (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
9-11 am (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
to fix a date (for an event)/to select an auspicious date
